abstract.p: Howard Goldberg reviews moscato d'ASti wine from Michele Chiario and muscat from Bonny Doon Vineyard; photos (M)

block.p: Sauternes, from France, and trockenbeerenauslese, from Germany, thrive in cool weather and deserve crystal on formal tables. But moscato d'Asti begs for July, August and September on the patio, especially a version from Michele Chiarlo that floats as lightly as its name, Nivole, which means ''clouds'' in Piedmontese dialect.
The '99 edition is arriving in shops, though the '98 version is still being sold. Both should be drunk fresh, within two years of the vintage.

Sauternes, from France, and trockenbeerenauslese, from Germany, thrive in cool weather and deserve crystal on formal tables. But moscato d'Asti begs for July, August and September on the patio, especially a version from Michele Chiarlo that floats as lightly as its name, Nivole, which means ''clouds'' in Piedmontese dialect.
The '99 edition is arriving in shops, though the '98 version is still being sold. Both should be drunk fresh, within two years of the vintage.
Nivole's full-blown perfume is a treat, and the demure, seductive muscat flavor, tangy and semitropical, lingers teasingly.

This classy, delicate, pale-straw-yellow dessert wine, made from moscato bianco grapes, finishes dry, offering a charming illusion of restraint. The opportunity to nosh is controlled, too, by the quantity: the wine comes only in half-bottles (375 milliliters).
Chiarlo's '99 Nivole costs $9 at Wine and Spirits Emporium of Bronxville, 98 Pondfield Road, Bronxville, and the '98 is $9 at Thornwood Wines, 1004 Broadway, Thornwood.

Another version of muscat, echoing the whimsy of the irrepressible Randall Grahm, the maestro of Bonny Doon Vineyard in Santa Cruz, Calif., is his ambrosial and playful Vin de Glaciere (Wine of the Ice Box), a dessert ice wine created from frozen muscat canelli, orange muscat and malvasia bianca grapes from Monterey County.
The '98 version, available only in half-bottles, costs $18 at Bedford Wine Merchants, 24 Main Street, Bedford Village, and $19 at Piermont Wines, 503 Piermont Avenue, Piermont.
